summary: The International Bridge and Port of Entry Modernization Act of 2025 (IBEM Act of 2025) amends the International Bridge Act of 1972 to streamline the Presidential permitting process for international bridges and land ports of entry. This includes updates to definitions, removal of sunset clauses, and modifications to environmental review processes. The bill aims to facilitate improvements to infrastructure at the US borders with Mexico and Canada, particularly focusing on how these ports of entry are permitted.
